intro: Borreria divaricata, commonly known as the variable borreria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, dry fruits known as capsules. Borreria divaricata is often found in moist, shaded areas and can be used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
